comments:
This course surveys methods and algorithms used in modern operating systems.
Concurrent distributed operation is emphasized. The main topics covered are as follows:
process synchronization; interprocess communication; concurrent/distributed
programming languages; resource allocation and deadlock; virtual memory; protection
and security; distributed operation; distributed data; performance evaluation.
Students found this course “extremely interesting.” They felt that they learned a
lot and that the course was rewarding. Students noted that they learned more in this
computer science class than in other courses in the department.
Students enjoyed Professor Loo as a lecturer for this course. Some students felt
that the content in lectures was disconnected from the content covered in projects, which
they found frustrating.
The course was highly recommended for computer science majors. Almost every
respondent noted that the course is very time-intensive. There were three big projects,
which became more time-consuming and intense over the semester.
